text: On draft at the source. Pours cloudy brownish red with a thick white head. Strong oak notes, caramel, penny candy,. Very tannic oak flavor, sawdust. Light body, stronger carbonation than the non barrel version. Over oaked.

Bottle at Hair of the Dog. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with raisins, hops, ripe fruits, oak, bourbon, a bit of alcohol and pine. Bitter finish with citrus, raisins, ripe fruits, resin, hops, oak, bourbon, vanilla and grass. Exquisite brew.

Pours hazy dark golden to orange with creamy white head. Fruity, malty, wood, lots of dried fruit, vanilla. Quite sweet with a light sourish note and bitterness in finish. Oily, soft carbonation, complex. Full bodied. Great one.
LCI. From tap @ACBF2017. Very soft sweet barley wine with a subtle hint of wood. Not too sweet, just perfectly balanced with the wood tones. Lovely!

@ ACBF 2017. Goudgeel bier met koperen schijn. Lichte fijne schuimkraag. Redelijk houterig aroma en smaak. Perzik, nectarine en andere steenvruchten, caramel, kandijsuiker. Vol en warm in de mond, redelijk plakkerige afdronk. Lekker bier maar toch wat mij betreft een tikje te zoet, te kleverig/plakkerig.

Sampled at ACBF 2017, Vichte. Hazy golden pour with a fine-grained off-white head. Notes of whiskey, cherries, light smoke, caramel, hoppy pine resin, brett bitterness and some other subtle brett notes. Full-bodied, medium carbonation.
Zeer malty aroma. In de smaak veel malt, maar ook hop en alcohol. De koppigheid geeft het aparte draai aan barrels wine. Top

At ACBF. Bubbly but fairly stable, medium thick, snow white head, hazy peach blonde with warm orangey hue. Strong bouquet of candied peaches, cognac, vanilla, lovely wood tannins, sweet white grapes, roses, honey liqueur. Sweet, fruity onset, melon, candied orange, pineapple, soft carbo, honeyish sweetness stretching out over a rounded, mellow caramelly malt sweet middle, eventually very vinous mouthfeel, full, with a woody finish including retronasal vanilla oak, a dash of spicy hops, lingering residual sugary sweetness but most of all, a lot of calvados-like, expressive alcohol, heating the back of the mouth - perhaps a bit too sharply so, but still not wry or unpleasant in terms of flavor. I can see this improve a lot with age as the alcohol mellows a bit; in this young form a bit too boozy for my taste, but as a whole this is clearly a fantastic sipper, which Id be more than happy to revisit.

Fat på Omnipollos Hatt. Smutsdisig, brunorange vätska utan något skum. Rejält söt doft med massor av kolaremmar, apelsinskal, torkad frukt, lönnsirap. Mellanstor. Stor i smaken med kola, lönnsirap, fatinslag, lite apelsinskal och apelsinchoklad, vanilj, värmande alkohol som nästan blir lite spritig. Ruskigt potent, både i doft och smak. Kaxig för sina 10%. Kanske lite, lite för tunn för min smak. Samma öl med lite mer kropp hade varit en svårslagen barley wine.

0.355l bottle from 2008 shared with The Tasting Crew. Been looking forward to this! Its really cloudy this, almost murky brown in the glass and it has a small quickly islandy and sidesticking off-white head. Lovely sweet vanillaish aroma with buttery caramel, lots of oxidation, brown cheese, a little bit of minty toothpaste, ripe old berries, some alcohol and dark caramel. Lovely stuff. The carbonation level is just below average, small bubbles an it has a kinda sticky oily mouthfeel. Lovely sweet and oxidized flavors with lots of raisin and dates sweetness. Really concentrated and sharp flavors that just tastes spot on. Its definitely woody also, really flavorful and a really nice creation. 08.06.2013
Aroma is very caramel, candy - extra malty. No hear or carbonation. Somewhat astringent. Flavours is awesome, sweet but well balanced. Caramel maltsand a bit of booze.
Seriously this is the best. Great nose with a strong white wine wine nose. Great body and overall a great beer.

Bright and slightly cloudy tawny amber gold with one finger of fine sandstone tan head. Nose shows tons of oak, buttery and spicy notes with wood, burnt sugar, dense caramel, and warming alcohol. Very very rich flavor with treacle and burnt sugar upfront. Warming and coating finish. Very spicy and buttery oak with a slightly vegetal component.
Orange brown, nice head, aroma of toffee, wood, vinous, fruity, cherries, excellent, flavor of toffee, wood, vinous, cherry, fruity, excellent, medium+ bodied.

From bottle to tulip. I love everything from HOTD, and love the Fred. But this one missed the mark for me and was muddled and disjointed throughout. Notwithstanding that, I love Fred Eckhardt and am sure he is enjoying a beer with Michael Jackson right now.
Overall: Sweet raisins, wood, dried apricots, nuts. Bitter almonds.Note: On-tap at Omnipollos hatt. Reviewed 2016-07-10.

Pours hazy rose hip with low white head 
Aromas of fudge, caramel, dried fruits, malty backbone, vanilla 
Taste has notes of caramel, dried fruits, oak, fudge, hints of vanilla 
Mouthfeel is creamy, full bodied, low to medium carbonation, medium sweetness, medium bitterness

Draught at Omnipollos Hatt. Light hazy deep amber liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of raw sugar, wood, raisins, bourbon, red berries and light toffee. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, raisins, red berries, bourbon and light booze. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Very nice.
Poured from the tap. Golden orange with white head. Vanilla wood, caramel, grapefruit hops.
Bottle shared, thanks Will! Damn this is great, feels like spiced honey berries dancing on my palate, deep and complex flavors, lovely balance, I finally get the hype about these guys. Amazing!

Tap at Omnipollos Hatt. Pours clear amber with very small, thin line off white head. Aroma is dominated by caramel, honey, vanilla and a little boozy notes. Taste is sweetish but balanced between vanilla, bourbon, honey, caramel and some light spices.

Draught at Hatten.
Pale clear bright orange amber, no head.
Gluey alcohol caramel and dried fruits with some leather and spice.
Sweet and spicy alcoholic with leather, citrus and dried fruits. Spicy prickly alcoholic finish. Salty.
Big body, low pointy carbonation, oily sticky.
Complex, hot and fruity. Probably quite nice after a few years.

2008 vintage bottle shared at the Grem. Huge oak-forward nose with honey, caramel, dark fruit, vanilla and star anise. Good sherry-like mouthfeel with more vanilla and oak really dominating again. Very creamy on the palate. Sweet and oaky on the finish. Really fantastic beer for a person who doesnt like most barley wines.
Bottle. Thanks Will. Booze, berries, honey, raisins, bourbon, sweet and rich caramel, treacle. Great stuff.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2016 On tap at the brewery. Cloudy orange pour with bone white foam and top to bottom sheeting lace. Taste is sweet and savory with fantastic flavors of toasted coconut, toffee, vanilla, licorice. Aroma is woody along with all other taste deScriptors. Finely carbonated, creamy mouthfeel. My first perfect beer after almost seven years on this site, holy cow. Regular Fred is one of my favorite beers of all time and barrel aging just raises up an already awesome beer to phenomenal in every respect.

Draft. Aroma of. Tight, thin lace. Flavors of apple cider, chewy caramel, a hint of toffee. Oak comes through at the finish, slightly high register, then a clean finish. No hint of booze. Just flavor.
@ Hair of the dog 16-3-9: stor tydlig bourbonton med smak av russin och malt. Småtrevlig.
On tap at the Brewpub. Amber with a small head. On the sweet side with dried fruit, oak, bourbon and caramel. A pleasant one to sip.

Bottle (12 oz). Vintage 2013. From cparles, thanks! Clear dark copper with a small beige head leaving little lacing. Aroma is wonderfully complex with molasses, oak, vanilla, toasted malts, tobacco, figs, dates, toffee, raisins, caramelized apples, chocolatey notes and mild to moderate spiciness. Taste is mellow and reasonably sweet with tobacco, vanilla, oak, raisins, toffee, caramel, toasted malts, chocolate, mild to moderate spiciness and a bit of alcohol. Full body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Liquorous mouthfeel. Fruity finish with a nice alcohol warmth. Wonderfully balanced and complex Barley Wine. Im usually not fond of the style, but I had no problem at all drinking the whole bottle by myself. Amazing beer!

Pours amber with a small head.
Nose shows oak, honey, vanilla, toffee, sherry and golden syrup.
Flavours include more golden syrup, soft booze, whisky-like characters, faint oxidised notes and soft grassy hops.
Seriously good.

Cannery Row Beer Club just tried a very meaningful beer. This is a special treat. Cheers!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours hazy chestnut, not much head. Fruity aroma has a woody hint. Woody, fruity and malty flavor is very enjoyable. Texture has OK body but plenty of fizz. This Fred is fun!

12oz bottle from the brewery smuggled into minnesota with commonmac . 2013 version . High sediment hazy Murky orange red with medium off white head. Very strong tart and sweet nose. Super aggressive aroma. Very sweet, syrup, bourbon, then yeast, alcohol, tart. Finish is well done and sticks with you. A ton of sugar. Delicious. Boozy but somehow in perfect balance. What I would want a barrel aged beer to taste like.

Bottle secretly acquired by Double Ts during a recent trip to Portland. 2013 Edition. Shared with commonshawn. Lots of sediment serving to make it very cloudy. A mahogany moving towards brown colored appearance with a little bit of off white, almost tan, head. Aroma has a hearty bourbon quality with an assertive sweetness. The taste is rich and deep with dark fruit (raisins, prunes) and a definite bourbon, peat characteristic. Alcohol warmth. Lots of sugars present as well...Im almost getting a slightly toffee or chocolate undertone. Dessert beer is the perfect way to describe this one. Im already looking forward to my next meeting with Fred. Hes a good dude.

Thnx to Dennis ! Pours clear blonde. Good white head. Smell is sweet, some oak. Taste is sweet, heavy, thick, Honey, complex sweet undertone. Vanilla, oak, very Nice ! Perhaps a tad too sweet, but very Nice

Drinking 2008 version on Christmas 2015. Deep amber golden color with quick dissipating head that results in absolutely flatness. The nose shows thick surupiness with caramel, raisins, prunes. The wood is virtually gone in the nose. The mouth is off sweet, low carbonation, very heavy body. Warming boozines. Caramel, oranges but found the depth wasnt as great as I anticipated. Perhaps I waited too long, perhaps in the aging process it is simply at a boring part of the spectrum. It is definitely well made but certainly 
Doesnt make motivated to try it again. Drank with step dad who said he doesnt know much about barleywine but this seems awefully boring.

12oz bottle with a 2009 date, brought from the source by STEVE and cellared for the 2 years since. Shared with ck1 & Jan on Spit Cup/2000th weekend. My 50th barleywine - something I never would have thought would happen. Sweet fruit, raisin, grape. Sweetly tasty. Very, very smooth. Not thinking would ever want more from a barleywine. 16.2
2009 bottle. Caramel malt smell and taste. Medium body, medium carbonation, and no foam.

Vintage 2014. Un liquide plutôt laid avec sa robe brune un peu douteuse et sa tête complètement coupée. Au nez, chêne massif et malts en retrait, parfums doranges et tabac encore un peu vert. Au goût, lalcool est poivré, les malts maintenant doux, le bois piquant, le caramel évasif, les raisins dorés et des herbes amérisantes. En bouche, un corps moyen-fort sans bulles et huileux. En finale, une chaleureuse accolade dalcool dans lequel est infusé des épices et des écorces dagrumes.

Bottle thanks to VanJamer @ BA. It pours a medium-strong golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing (this bottle opened with a nice hiss, quite unexpected!). Nose is of butterscotch, coconut and vanilla. Taste is of alcohol at first but it soon develops into a rich coconut, oak and caramel experience. Body is full, carbonation low to medium and the alcohol is just appropriate for the style and smooth. Quite a nice dessert, not too extreme!

Bottle 12oz [2014].
Pours copper with low off-white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of bourbon, malt, fruits. Classy. Taste is of bourbon, fruits, malt, slight bitterness. Palate: Full bodied. Soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice. Classy. Boozy.

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks bro! pours unclear medium dark golden, orange-red tint, with a small off-white cap, reviving and leaving nice lacing. bourbon-soaked red fruitiness - bananas and coconut; complex toffee spiciness, citrus peel, clean yeast. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; sweet and woody-spicy finish. good barrel-forward barleywine but far from original fred.

12 oz. bottle. About a year old, shared by AdamC. Amber/ light brown color with a very low carbonation. Aroma is nice, tobacco leaves, toasted oak, figs, raisins and English toffee. 

The flavor is just awesome, mellow molasses with a great amount of dark fruits. Toasted oak is mild and refined, the age hides any trace of alcohol. Vanilla oak, tobacco leaves and figs with toffee. The really impressive thing is it shows no sugar at all. The texture and mouthfeel is smooth, wow, very nice! Truly well made.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2016 April 8, 2016. On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 
Lacks the woody tannic and vinegar notes, still quite dominated by dried apricots and canned peach. 

Original rating:
October 10, 2015. Bottle at home, vintage 2008. Received in a trade with heyta, thanks!  Clear amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is oxidized sherry notes, caramel, peach, figs, raisins, wood, alcohol and hints of balsamic vinegar. Taste is sweet with peach, caramel and dried fruits. Finish is slightly tannic, sweet caramel and figs with dry wood, warming alcohol and a touch of balsamic vinegar. Medium to full bodied, soft, small bubble carbonation, oily texture. 
Not what I expected but good for what it is, its clearly past its prime getting notes of balsamic vinegar. 

7-3-7-3-15=35

Bottle courtesy of mortlach. Grazie. Pours cloudy caramel color, some lacing only. Nose: caramel, sweet cherries, some wood, jam. Nice. Mouth: very sweet but not disturbing, some bitter end cutting the body, gently carbonated, sugar, complex stuff. Definitely sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ 3/4 Dangerous Bottle Shares! does Copenhagen minishare. Slight hazy dark golden pour with tiny lacings. Vanilla, caramel, syrup, malty sweet, butterscotch with a sweet boozy finish.

Flaska från 2008 på Akkuratt, Stockholm. Ljus bärnstensfärgad, lite skum. Maltig doft av karamell, honung, ektoner. Smak av detsamma. Döljer alkoholen väl. Går lite åt mjödhållet, men mindre än den vanliga Fred, tack vare eklagringen. God!

Bottle enjoyed @ CBC Frivillig fest. Pours muddy brownish with the tiniest white head. Aroma is vanilla, wood, caramel, raw honey, rancid (but in a good way), malty and alcohol. Full bodied, soft carbonation. Finish is dry, bittersweet and long.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks DSG. Murkey amber-brown, white ring. Sweet fruity aroma, raisins, caramel and some cinnamon and cumin, spicy, nutty taste and a little alcoholic. Full-bodied, spicy, some nutmeg finish, mildly carbonated. Really tasty.

Bottle. The pour is a thickish hazy murky dark copper color with a full body, probably the most interesting looking beer I have ever seen. The aroma is boozy, but a lot of different things going on. The taste is almost perfect for a barley wine. I had a 2013, and might have been the perfect age. Highly recommended.

This is the 08 version and man o man, I didnt know Yaweh / JC worked as a brewmaster. Because Shirley there is a divine hand in this beer. All of the qualities are traditional and tweaked to the nth degree. The oak matches the malt matches the hops matches the yeast all perfectly & without flaw. Body couldnt be better. Appearance is better than I expected.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2015 Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. 2014 bottle. Hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of caramel, cookies, vanilla, fruitiness and wood. Sweet flavor with caramel, wood, vanilla, some cookies, coconut, fruitiness, an alcoholic touch, and a bitterish finish. Rounded mouthfeel. Great stuff.

Bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs; thanks DuffMan). 2014 vintage. Looks good; a very hazy orangish caramel with fizzy eggshell head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells and tastes good too; malty with notes of caramel, toffee, dark fruit, and oak. Some vanilla and a bit of coconut too.  Pleasantly boozy with a bittersweet backbone. Mouthfeel is full-bodied. Great beer, AND ITS CARBONATED!!!

12oz bottle - 2014 vintage - pours a cloudy amber . Aromas of spice , dark fruit , faint woody bourbon note . Taste is sweet figs and dates , mild hop presence . Very Very Good ! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2008 bottle thanks to Daniel. Pours a cloudy orange with small off white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is vanilla and oak. Medium mouth, sweet malt, light woody finish, hides alcohol well, really enjoyed this one.
Bottle pour split, thanks Andrew for sharing this one. Tried this one with the regular Fred. Deep amber color. Sweet wood aroma, very similar to the Fred just with a smoke wood flavor.

12 oz bottle, picked up from the brewery a little while back. Poured, and compared to the regular Fred version. 2014 Fred from the Wood. Pours an oily orange color with a swirling fizz white head. Sweet, brown sugar like aroma, with a touch of vinegar. Flavor is much more dry than the regular version, which is one thing I noticed right away. I dont want to make this rating a total comparison, so that will be my compare and contrast note. Dry wood like flavor with some maple, and cinnamon sugar. Nice roasted finish to it. Very nice overall, but if we play the compare game, I have to give the nod to the original, though its less than 1/10th of a point.

Bottle thanks to Rob. I found this really odd. It definitely worked but was unusual compared with other BWs Ive had. Very citric and sharp to begin with, then loads of vanilla and coconut on the finish. Absolutely no hint of the 12%. Crazy drinkability. Sweet. Very good
Batch 64 Thanks again to Skyhand. Drank around 2007ish. Not much more to say about this precious beauty after 740 rating except that we all know Alan is THE MAN. Dank.

Bottle from 2008. Pours dark murky brown with a small slightly offwhite head. Aromas of caramel, chocolate, malt, dark fruits, some faded hops, lots of earthy oaky notes, light salmiak licorice. Taste is roasted, caramel, licorice, some hops, oaky notes, raisins, dark chocolate, dry bitter finish. Amazing body, very nice balance!

Bottle. 2008. Pours hazy deep amber with nice beige head. Impressing! Feels dense in the glass. Aroma is sweet, malty, jammy. Burnt caramel and only slight old hops. Vanilla and some spices. Some honey. Taste is sweet, caramel, dark fruits, malt, toffee, oaky vanilla. With nice carbonation. Tickling alcohol in finish and vanilla. Slight dry finish too from the hops.

Bottle from 2008. Pours a murky orange-brown with a surprisingly big, dense, head. Aroma has huuuge, sweet barrel character. Lots of oak and vanilla, toasted malts, toffee, caramel, figs, prunes, booze. Taste is very sweet, but with a big complexity between all the fruity and the oaky notes. Dry finish and with a lively carbonation that really lifts the otherwise pretty oily body. Lots of booze! Really nice.

Bottle from a care that Galbo landed. Pours a hazy deep orange color with little head but good lacing. The aroma is oak and alcohol at first, maybe some burnt malt sweetness. Taste is not bitter, semi-sweet, oaky, an alcohol burn, thick. Heavy on the palate. I'm having difficulty rating this because at first it didn't knock it out for me, but I think it's getting better as I drink it. Would like to try it beside their other beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2011 bottle shared by Marcus. Pours light see threw amber. Taste is vanilla oak. Candied malt. And sweet.
Review based on 2009 bottle. Full carbonation. Perfect full bodied, complex joy. Brilliantly sweet.
2013 12 oz bottle. Smells like a canister of zig zag tobacco with a touch of brown sugar. Taste is barleywineish candy, wood, molasses. Ok, probably would much better in a bourbon barrel.

Bottle during (mostly) Hair of the Dog beers tasting. Many thanks again Jef!
APPEARANCE: dark blond beer, small unstable off white head.
NOSE: alcohol, oak, fruity.
TASTE: alcohol, very sweet, oak, nice.

Bottle @ HOTD tasting. Shared with Yarrick, PriorL, Mathieu87 and Chris. Dark brown colour, thin layer of dark brown foam. Medium carbonation. Malty body. Aroma of prunes, brown sugar, vanilla, oak and toast. Well balaned but maybe a bit too sweet.
Pours dark mahogany with a light tan head. Smell huge bourbon vanilla, oak. Taste oak, caramel, char, and toffee, very sweet and a bit hot. Medium to full bodied.

How: Bottle, 2008 vintage.
Where: Tasting at omhper.
Appearance: Hazy amber colour with a small off-white head.
Aroma: Caramel, malt, raisin, fruit.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Raisin, dried fruit, alcohol, malt.
Sampled during RBSG. From notes. Bourbon, oak, caramel, dark fruit and spices.

2014 poured from bottle to glass. Hazy copper hue with creamy off white head. Aroma is toffee, oak, tobacco, prune, ethanol. Mouthfeel is great with a full body and crisp carbonation. Taste is sweet with an oaky tannin following and an ethanol finish. Overall this is a very nice brew.
Tap at Hair of the Dog. Pours hazy brow with orange hues and white head. Aroma is strong wood, tons of oak, chocolate, prunes. Taste is rich, a wood bomb. Overall, very good.

On tap at the HOTD rating room. Pours medium hazy Amber, small cream hued head. Big nose of oak, booze, dark fruits. Major booze burn up front, molds into dark fruits, oak, vanilla. Potent stuff for sure. Finish adds more booze burn. Wow.

Bottled, thanks 3fourths!  Hazy amber, small head. Generous oaky vanilla and caramel aroma. Sweet with full body and soft mouthfeel, low carbonation. Wonderfully well structured, white wine, caramel, vanilla and oak. Warming finish. Fantastic stuff!

"Had this mixed up with Bourbon FFTW. I actually like this one better as it tones down the sweet boozinees while adding a layer of oaky complexity while maintaining the fruit and slightly bitter aspect of the base. Great stuff."

Bottle, thanks Paul. Brown with tan head. Interesting aroma, lots of vanilla and some coconut, some dried fruit, raisins and caramel. Taste is complex, smooth and balanced, vanilla, dried fruits. Sweet and warming. Delish

Bottle: Thanks, Kevin. Very deep brown body; rust-laden & orange tinted edges with an opaque center. Quick settling beige head on top. Aroma is an American oak bomb. Tons of wood, soaked in booze, caramel, molasses, & sprinkled with brown sugar. Undercurrent of raisin, black cherry, & earthy tobacco leaves. Nice balance of dark fruit & wood. Taste follows along with a mouthful of oak, brown sugar, burnt caramel, apples, raisins, blackcurrant, & a robust booziness flowing from front to back. Sticky toffee, oak, & very mild vanillin in the aftertaste with a palate coating adhesion. Creamy body. Nice balance of dark fruitiness, malty sweetness, & boozy woodiness all around. Hair of the Dog, king of the slow sippers.

12oz bottle pours semi clear ruby red brown with 2 finger head. Nose is rich earthy malty grain, dark bread, some dark fruit, grape, wood, spirit. Taste is similar with a nice creamy mouthfeel and pleasant bready fruit and booze spice on the finish.

Bottled sample (2008) via and shared with oakbluff. Pale amber on colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of oaked chardonnay (Chablis-like), marzipan, and pale malts. Flavors of honeycomb mix with more oaky chardonnay, golden delicious apples, and agave syrup. Long yet mellow on the palate. It has aged gracefully.
Bottle from the internets. Pours a hazy amber with minimal off white head. Aroma of booze, caramel, and and sweetness. Taste of oak, booze, and smokiness.

Shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad!

The beer is copper hued and somewhat clear with a small tan cap. Aromas of bread, oak, sweet malt, vanilla, booze. Huge flavor. A huge wave of oak carries over from the aroma to flavor, with additional flavors of wet wood, earth, vanilla, malt. A potent offering. While this is indeed quite tasty, its best enjoyed in small servings.
UPDATED: JUL 24, 2014 Bottle, 2013 vintage. shared at RBAG 2014 I believe by Graham? Tawny amber, low head. Rich toffee and raw oak, a little spicy. A bit hot alcohol in the finish. Very nice.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: RBAG. Brown pour. Bigtime bourbon aromas, lots of oak. Flavour is bourbon, very boozy and warming, but really nice sipping stuff. I think this bottle was 2013

2013 bottle. Dark brown pour, light white head. Aroma of tobacco, sweet malts, and brown sugar. Taste is sweet up front, followed by some tobacco spice, mixed in with some malty sweetness, finish is a bit sharp with some spice. Cool.

Bottle during RBSG 2014 Grand Tasting at Schlafly Tap Room. Batch 64. Dark caramel brown with off-white ring. Aromas of oak, booze, bourbon, dark fruit. Tastes of oak, bourbon, dark fruit, caramel. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Sampled at Grand Tasting during RBSG. Pours a cloudy amber brown color with white head. A lot of oak, caramel, brown sugar, bourbon flavors.

This beer pours a very hazy orange color witha s mall head of white bubbles. There is light bit of vinnegar in the nose and a touch of citrus. This is only lightly tart once tasted but very oxidized, the only pleasant barrel flavor Im really getting from this is vanilla. It is sweet and sticky and texture and overall a pretty big disappointment.

Tasted at RBSG grand tasting. 12oz bottle. Ratebeer version. Pour towards the end. Totally cloudy amber brown color. Thin ring off-white head, dots of ropes of lace. Very interesting aroma. Malty flavor, oxidization. Medium plus body. Smooth, lighter carbonation, dry finish. Moderate sweet taste, some bitter, dry finish. Kind of like a desert wine in the flavor. Some light heat on the end. Solid, interesting stuff to try, but my guess is that its seen better days. 6/4/6/4/13
Clear amber of color with an off white head. An aroma of honey, sweets, malt, caramel, bourbon and spice. A flavor of caramel, sweets, spice, weak bitter and honey.

2013 bottle. Hazy dark mahogany color with a medium beige head that diminishes steadily. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of oak, dark fruits and molasses. Full-bodied with an oaky booze character and flavors of dark fruit, caramel malt, chocolate and subtle spice. The finish is oaky with caramel and fruit aftertaste. Very good beer all around.
Rich beer, with notes of raisin, oak and off course malt. The bourbon gives the beer a great taste of warm vanilla.

At my place with J dog and wifey. Dat pour look like spooky brown water. Dis aroma b like a a brown box and Afro pick, with some Carmel lolli pop. Taste is caramel, cardboard, interesting dark wood notes. Meh.

Via trade with SetauketBrewer. Gorgeous aroma of fruit, sherry, vanilla, oak. The appearance is deep brown rec, murky, off white head. The flavor is boozy, fruity, sherry, oak. The finish is boozy, oak, pine. Medium to medium/thick in body, lots of carbonation. Very nice.

2009 bottle shared thanks to Spdyfire83. Pours cloudy golden amber with a tan head. Aroma is a little bretty (infection?), wood, caramel, light fruits, grapes. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
Some funk in the aroma? Thin white head. Cloudy golden/amber pour. Still sweet. Some woody notes. very nice.
Tap at brewery. Dark brown pour with good head. Oak, caramel, sherry, sugar, raisin. Very good
Pours dark brown with a foamy white head. Aroma of wood, caramel, vanilla, and nuts. Taste is big brown sugar, booze, caramel, and wood. Tasty

Bottle at home. Pour is murky, orange brown with a big fluffy cream-colored head and great lacing. Big caramel, raisins, toffee, plums, figgy, woody, sherry, bourbon, grapey, and earthy aroma. Taste is brown sugar, caramel, burnt raisins, bready, light cocoa, toffee, candied oranges, grass, and marshmallows. Creamy mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Another beautifully crafted, easy-drinking barley wine from Hair of the Dog. Delicious!
ivorywhite head, disappears quickly without lacing. amber clear colour. aroma of cherry, porto, sweet, candysugar. taste like aroma with sweet finish. medium body and carbonation.

Reddish brown colour, off-white head. Aroma of wood, red fruits, vanilla, bourbon, malts, dried fruits and alcohol. Malty flavour, wood, vanilla, liquorice, dried fruits, quite sweet. Full body. Finish vanilla, wood, malts, caramel and red fruits. Nice!!!
(From 33cL bottle shared @ the pre-RBBWG get-together at Tims place. Vintage 2013. Gift by Vincent, thanks!! It has been thoroughly enjoyed!)

Semi-transparent deep, deep ruby mahogany color with a moderate off-white head. Complex aroma of caramel, figs, dates, stone fruits, wood, and a little leather. Hazy golden color, with bits of sediment floating about, half finger head receded quickly after the pour. Almost no lacing.
The aroma is full of carmalised sugars, I also detect sweet fruit and a bit of fusle oil from the oak barrels. There is sweet malty aroma that realy comes out as well.
The flavor is nice and sweet with a bit of spiciness and booze. There is also a hoppy bitterness in the finish that I dont find frequently in American barleywines. 
The mouth feel is very Nice. This brew is incredibly silky with a nice open center and slightly bitter finish that warms on the way down.

bottled, big thanks to 3/4 for lugging this one with him to pilsen - id been dead keen to try it for ages. anyways, poured a murky amber with a steady thin head. aroma reminded me of italian almond biscuits, freshly poured tar, whiteboard marker; explosion of flavours - bloody nose, tomato vine, sherbet, whisked eggwhites. bold yet subtle, intense yet reinvigorating

08/02/2012 Bir&Fud Bottega (Vintage 2008). Ambrata, viva, abbastanza limpida, schiuma biancastra, poco abbondante e poco persistente. Al naso aroma intensissimo, quasi pervade tutta la stanza. Malto, caramello, zucchero di canna, vaniglia, ma anche luppolo. In bocca è complessa, potente attacco maltato, caramellato, e gran finale con luppolo protagonista nel retrogusto con nette note legnose al palato. Corpo pieno, buona carbonazione. Nonostante i quattro anni, scalcia ancora parecchio.

355 ml bottle. 2008 vintage.
Originally rated on 20090305. 
Pours clear copper colour with minimal head. Aroma o ripe fruit, herbs, caramel, toffee and wood notes. Exquisite on flavour and very balanced brew alltogetrher.
5416

2009 bottle c/o Secret Santa 2011!  Slightly gushy; pours a ruddy orange and red color with a medium-sized ultra-creamy orange and tan head with long retention.  Beautiful.  Aromas of sharp, tart cherry, yeast, buttery oak, Chardonnay, and sour fruit.  The flavor is sweet initially, with sugared plum and orangepeel and cherry.  This moves to sour cherry and buttery oak.  The finish is tart and fruity, with sugar cane.  Very creamy, with low carbonation and a rich mouthfeel.  Awesome.  This is really fucking nice.  [917]

Bottle, 2009. Pours a clear cherry color. Smells of fruit, red berries, and some sour aspects. Tastes sweet, a bit like molasses initially, with a full body and syrupy texture with plenty of fruit. Cinnamon. Cherry. Brown sugar. Really quite tasty, though probably not one I?d go to regularly.

2009 Bottle. Poured copper with a thin off-white head. Aromas of dark fruit, vanilla, and light spice. The flavor found dark fruits, oak, cedar, cherry, and light spices. Medium body, smooth, sweet, sticky, and a light lingering alcohol.

Batch 2008 thx dearly to ¾ Burnt orange color very small head. The initial smell is oxidized then custard apple, mamey sapote. Rich sweet intense high caloric tropical fruit and the flavors are also fruity but different there is more acidity, grapefruit, bitter orange. So much Im getting hit over the head, in a good way, is totally unique not like any other beer Ive had...and weird rating a beer like this...dry tannin in finish is white sherry from barrel! 
Batch 64 rb edition, also thx dearly to ¾ is darker than other batch, red orange, chestnut auburn brown type color, nice oxidized character, charred pineapple. Woody finish but more muddled than other one, but still has fun grapefruit in finish just more subtle and balanced and integrated. I preferred the 2008.

Medium amber-brown.  The aroma is very barrelly, with a lot of vanilla and a little bit of caramel.  Rich and full of barrel and chocolate.  Dessert, and with with peachy esters as well.  Smooth finish, very rounded and stylish.  Great beer.2008 vintage, courtesy 3/4.  Hazy amber with a nice, thin head.  The aroma is full of oak, vanilla, rich malts, hints of chocolate...quite complex.  At once smokey sweet like barbeque sauce, rich malty barley wine, hop and alcohol dryness, oaky finish...even some light fruits.  Serious business, a great beer with a lot of subtlety.  Smooth full body...great brew, just goes on and on. 8 3 9 5 18 =4.3

12oz bottle split into Danish samples with the DC crew.  Unfiltered orange-tan with a foamy off-white head.  This is really quite nice, the oak barrel really balances it out and adds some depth.  Some orange-liqueur tones, Pretty solid beer, expert execution.

Denmark, Aug-Sept 2009. Bottle from Beer Paradise , Holstebro. Pours dark amber with a tiny head. Sweet malt aroma with lots of aromatic flower hops, notes of oak and sherry. Rioe fruit flavours combiend with vanilla ,oak, spices, sweetness is very well balanced by the hops. Great mouthfeel. Complex, balanced and highly enjoyable. Wish I was able to try this more often.

On tap at Hair of the Dog. Pours a cloudy red/brown/orange with a small ring of head. Aroma of wood, molasses, coffee, oak, fresh tobacco. Flavour of fresh tobacco, wood, lots of oak, rye, lightly charred/smoked and booze. Dry, sweet and woody. Balanced really nicely.

12 oz. bottle at Hair of the Dog, split with Matts_Property, pours a beautiful cherry-like dark red with minimal tan head. Aroma of brandied fruits, candied sugar, light wood notes, tobacco and oak. Flavour brings out the tobacco and smoky wood upfront, with dry brandied / candied fruits and some sweetness. Very complex with a smoky, sweet, but dry palate. Excellent.

36cl, Batch 64 (RateBeer Edition), exclusive American brew, thx to Walt!, very complex brew, sweet/alcoholic and slightly woody/fruity, not too heavy, very balanced, cloudy, nearly no head, very good brew!

Bottle shared by MrPickles...thanks Andy! - Pours clear dark reddish amber with a small foamy tan head. Lightly smoky, with some savory spices, lots of cedar, and a bit of lightly spicy hops. Taste has a fruity component--cherry?--with a spicy woodiness, light smoke, and a clean, robust, malty finish. Smooth, slick, and pretty big bodied, with reasonable carbonation. Very nice stuff.

2009 on Draft. Aroma: Caramel, toasted,  fresh-cut wood and vanilla.
Flavor: big toasted flavors with French vanilla and bourbon
Comments:  My description doesnt do this justice as it is super complex.  This is what wood aging should be like.  It blows away competition.

Bottle.  Pours  rich dar brown color, medium-sized off-white head and good lacing. Nose of of dark ripe fruit, vanilla, and wood. Medium to full-bodied with an alcoholic mouthfeel. Flavor is sweet with a lot of fruit and vanilla. Reall good!

Bottle, courtesy GT2. Big thanks! Pour is a hazy gold with an excellent beige head, good lacing/retention. Aroma is oaky, malty, with lots of butterscotch, vanilla, citrus. Taste is very similar to original fred: butterscotch, soft citrus, with a nice dose of oak and vanilla from the barrel aging. Palate is sticky, light-medium body, smooth sweet finish. Really nice, similar to the original with a nice twist. Outstanding.

HotD knows BWs and Old Ales. This beer keeps in line with their fine brewing tradition. I would suggest footing the bill and trying any of their line up (except Ruth) when ever you run across them. Dont be afraid to grab 1 or 2 for the cellar these beers a very nice agers.

Thanks to drgonzo for sharing this one. Pours golden with a touch of white head. Smell: sweet caramel malt, oak, some citrus fruits and some funk. Taste: Caramel, oak barrel, vanilla and almost some belgian candied sugars. Thick on the palate and a rather sweet finish.

Bottle. Beautiful clear amber pour with white head and abundant sticky lacing. Lots of oak, tobacco, herbs, vanilla, some off pickle notes but not bad. Excellent taste, lots of toffee, super rich and sweet, quite complex, very different from the aroma, burnt caramel. Rich, full bodied, good carbonation for a barrel aged beer. Excellent barleywine, pretty much the top in its style.

At the time of this review, this beer is the #13 top American Strong Ale on the beeradvocate.com best of styles lists. Bottle shared by bmanning, served in a snifter. Thanks Ben! Long time want here.

Beer is yellowish and hazy with a lazy head, moderate to low carbonation, no lacing.

The aroma is sweet with hints of alcohol, a little wood and perhaps a little tobacco.

The beer is really nice, very good, light on the palate but strong throughout, a great little beer. Again, I wish I had a Fred to taste side by side but this lived up to my memory of Fred, I would have it again, hopefully someday in a side by side with a similar vintage bottle of Fred. Very nice beer here.
At hotd with Carla. Pours a clear red/orange with no foam. Smells sweet of oak, vanilla and orange. Tastes of orange with plenty of alcohol and ends almost spicy. Akin to rum.

on tap @hotd this past weekend poured a dark golden brownish hue
notes of dates strong dark fruit it wasnt as woody in the noes as it was in the taste wow it was a peice of bark and vanilla leather and straw with good dark fruit notes it kicked butt in the preverbal world of fred on tap
Bottle @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Originally rated on 17.9.2010. Well balanced and tasty, complex dark ale with notes of wood and oak.

Bottle split with Pat, Dad and Uncle Jim. Pours a nice hazy, cloudy orange body with some light fizzy white lacing. Aroma is musky, sweet malts, oak, and lemon. Mouthfeel is medium with similar notes in the flavor - additional notes of floral spices.
